## Some Nonlinear Equations in Chemical Engineering

 1. The Antoine equation </br> $log_{10} (p^*) = A - \dfrac{B}{T+C}$

 2. The Arrhenius equation </br> $k = k_0 \exp(-E_a / RT)$

 3. The Benedict-Webb-Rubin equation </br> $P = \frac{RT}{\hat{V}} + \left( B_0 RT - A_0 - \frac{C_0}{T^2} \right) \frac{1}{\hat{V}^2} + \left( bRT - a \right) \frac{1}{\hat{V}^3} + \frac{\alpha a}{\hat{V}^6} +$ </br> $\frac{c}{\hat{V}^3 T^2} \left( 1 + \frac{\gamma}{\hat{V}^2} \right) \exp \left( -\frac{\gamma}{\hat{V}^2} \right)$



## How Do You Solve Them on a Spreadsheet?

  - Set up as $f(x) = 0$. 


  - Guess and Check </br> $\hspace{2mm}$ Root is between sign changes 


  - Graph it and Guess and Check


  - Goal Seek

## Set Up as f(x) = 0

 1. The Antoine equation </br> $f(p*)$ or $f(T) = log_{10} (p^*) - A + \dfrac{B}{T+C}$

 2. The Arrhenius equation </br> $f(T) = k - k_0 \exp(-E_a / RT)$

 3. The Benedict-Webb-Rubin equation </br> $f(\hat{V}) = P - [\frac{RT}{\hat{V}} + \left( B_0 RT - A_0 - \frac{C_0}{T^2} \right) \frac{1}{\hat{V}^2} + \left( bRT - a \right) \frac{1}{\hat{V}^3} + \frac{\alpha a}{\hat{V}^6} +$ </br> $\frac{c}{\hat{V}^3 T^2} \left( 1 + \frac{\gamma}{\hat{V}^2} \right) \exp \left( -\frac{\gamma}{\hat{V}^2} \right)]$

## Goal Seek Suggestions

• Increase accuracy of x in f(x)=0 by multiplying f(x) by 108.

• Mark or label cell to set to 0 (the f(x) value).

• Mark or label cell to adjust (the x value).
